This is the icon I've built to track the number of mushrooms I've planted and what the remaining cooldown on Wild Mushroom: Bloom is. However after I blow them up it takes solid 2 seconds for the icon to realize that the mushrooms are gone, even though it has already started the cooldown timer on Bloom. Also when it finally does switch, it doesn't show the numerical timer, just the sweep. (The timer text is only enabled on the icon for 0 mushrooms, which is the icon the meta switches to after the icon for 3 mushrooms hides.)


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #616 | Raw

comments.body:
The delay is on Blizzard's side of things. The totem API, GetTotemInfo(slot), also does not update until really late, and this is the only way to get information about totems.

If you disable your unit frames and just use Blizzard's unit frames, you will notice that the icons for mushrooms also don't disappear for a few seconds.

Also, if you watch your mushrooms closely, you will see that right when you cast bloom, they bloom, but they don't explode or despawn for a short bit after you cast bloom.

The timer on the 0 mushroom icon seems to be working OK for me. Did OmniCC get disabled after the tiny patch that we just had? (it unchecked load out-of-date addons for me).

Edited Sep 14, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

The timer works alright on the icon itself. However it doesn't work on the metaicon. There the timer seems to start with the icon for 3 mushrooms (because of the delay). Then when the lag is over and the metaicon goes to the 0 mushroom icon it doesn't remember to show the timer.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Oh, you need to click show when unusable on the other 3 icons. I must've changed that between exporting the group and writing the ticket. Sorry about that.
